thread.title: Suspect, 19, arrested in deaths of two El Paso County teens
thread.title_full: Suspect, 19, arrested in deaths of two El Paso County teens

author: Kieran Nicholson
title: Suspect, 19, arrested in deaths of two El Paso County teens
text:
El Paso County Sheriff's Office Gustavo Marquez. A suspect has been arrested in the murders of two teenagers whose bodies were found on the side of an El Paso County road early on a Sunday morning.
Gustavo Marquez, 19, was arrested Sunday on suspicion of two counts of first-degree murder, two counts of aggravated robbery and two counts of child abuse resulting in death, according to the El Paso County Sheriff’s Office.
Marquez is being held at the El Paso County jail.
The bodies of Derek Benjamin Greer, 15, and Natalie Partida, 16, were spotted March 12 by a passer-by, a driver, near Fountain on Old Pueblo Road, just south of Hanover Road.
The victims were Coronado High School students and friends .
Marquez was arrested Feb. 24 in a felony kidnapping, assault and domestic violence case out of Fountain, according to state arrest records.
